title: Cognitive Load Prediction and Management Training During Patient Handoffs

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical terminology and foundational understanding of patient handover processes
context.additional_context: Language-based educational program for improving medical communication expertise.

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain three types of cognitive load (intrinsic, extraneous, germane) occurring during patient handoff processes.
Learners can improve work efficiency by analyzing cognitive load predictors such as fatigue levels, number of patients, and information sources during patient handoffs.
Learners propose strategies to enhance meaningful cognitive load by applying standardized handoff protocols and utilizing feedback systems.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
